meanings.sent1: The car highballed down the highway, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah highballed across the savanna, chasing its prey.
meanings.sent3: The rocket highballed into space, reaching for the stars.
meanings.sent4: The wind highballed through the trees, rustling the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster highballed down the track, thrilling its passengers.

meanings.definition: To signal a train to proceed at full speed.
meanings.sent1: The conductor highballed the train, waving the green flag enthusiastically.
meanings.sent2: The engineer highballed the locomotive, starting its journey with a loud whistle.
meanings.sent3: The train highballed out of the station, leaving a trail of steam behind.
meanings.sent4: The signalman highballed the express train, setting it on a fast course.
meanings.sent5: The passengers cheered as the train highballed out of the station, on time for their destination.

meanings.definition: To drink quickly or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: He highballed his soda, finishing it in one big gulp.
meanings.sent2: The party guests highballed their drinks, enjoying the festivities.
meanings.sent3: She highballed her milkshake, causing brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner highballed the water at the refreshment station.
meanings.sent5: The thirsty hiker highballed the water from his canteen, quenching his thirst.
